user_message:
<misra_rule>
The target MISRA C 2023 Rule 2.1 is: A project shall not contain unreachable code.

</misra_rule>
<instruction>
Other agents will judge whether the code follows the MISRA C 2023 guidelines.
They will investigate the code fragments you give.
Your job is to find code fragments in the code that should be investigated to check whether the code follows the MISRA C rule.
</instruction>
<response format>
Provide your answer with these fields.
- suspicious_frags: The list of suspicious code fragments in the code.
It should contain only the code fragments exists in the code. If you do not find any suspicious code fragments, return an empty list for suspicious_frags
- explanation: The explanation of why other code fragments should NOT be investigated.
It is very important to not miss any suspicious code fragments, so please give a sufficient explanation why other code fragments should not be investigated.
DO NOT give any explanation for the selected suspicious code fragments.
</response format>
<target_code>
Here is the code of OS_SetLocalTime_Impl:
```c
int32 OS_SetLocalTime_Impl(const OS_time_t *time_struct)
{
    int             Status;
    int32           ReturnCode;
    struct timespec TimeSp;

    TimeSp.tv_sec  = OS_TimeGetTotalSeconds(*time_struct);
    TimeSp.tv_nsec = OS_TimeGetNanosecondsPart(*time_struct);

    Status = clock_settime(OSAL_GETTIME_SOURCE_CLOCK, &TimeSp);

    if (Status == 0)
    {
        ReturnCode = OS_SUCCESS;
    }
    else
    {
        ReturnCode = OS_ERROR;
    }

    return ReturnCode;
}
```
</target_code>
<additional code>Here are the definitions of symbols that are related to the target function OS_SetLocalTime_Impl:
static inline int64 OS_TimeGetTotalSeconds(OS_time_t tm)
{
    return (tm.ticks / OS_TIME_TICKS_PER_SECOND);
}
...
static inline uint32 OS_TimeGetNanosecondsPart(OS_time_t tm)
{
    return (uint32)OS_TimeGetFractionalPart(tm) * OS_TIME_TICK_RESOLUTION_NS;
}
...
#define OSAL_GETTIME_SOURCE_CLOCK CLOCK_REALTIME
...
#define OS_SUCCESS (0)
...
#define OS_ERROR (-1)
</additional code>
Please find suspicious code fragments in the code and report them. Other agents can not investigate other fragments that you do not report, so it is very important to find all suspicious fragments without missing any. Report the suspicious fragments AS MUCH AS POSSIBLE.
explanation: The listed fragments are those that involve control flow or external return values that could make branches unreachable (the call to clock_settime and the consequent if/else, together with the macros that define the compared/assigned constant values). All other lines in the function are simple assignments or uses of inline helper functions that contain no conditional statements or alternative control-flow paths (for example the TimeSp.tv_sec/tv_nsec assignments and the inline OS_TimeGetTotalSeconds/OS_TimeGetNanosecondsPart definitions). Those other fragments therefore do not present an apparent unreachable-code issue under MISRA C:2023 Rule 2.1 and need no further investigation for that rule.
